paragraph.paragraph: Generic file items are all other file items that are not eiffel_classes.xmlEiffel Class File Items. These types of items will only be found anywhere under the ../../index.xmlProject Items folder or any of it's subfolder/clusters or under the ../../../other_project_items/index.xmlOther Project Items folder and it's subfolders.

Generic file items have many different icon representations. For the most part the icon used to represent the file item will be the same icon used by Windows Explorer. The exception to this rule is when the file, on disk corresponding to the file item, is missing. For this case the file item will be show using the missing file ../../../../../../images/icons/file_missing.ico icon.

To open a file item in the default editor:
Select the file item you want to open from your EiffelEnvision project.
From the View menu, select OpenNote: File that are missing (../../../../../../images/icons/file_missing.ico) cannot be opened.

For information on how to add one of the many generic file item templates or to add exiting files to your EiffelEnvision project , see ../../../../configuring/adding_items/adding_items.xmlAdding New and Existing Items.
Generic file item have their own context menu. Below discusses each available option.

Open
Opens the selected file item in the default editor.

Open With...
Displays the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfOpenWithDialog.htmOpen With dialog box allowing you to select an alternative editor to open the file item with.

Remove
Selecting this menu item will remove the file item from the project. See ../../../../configuring/removing_items.xmlRemoving Items for more information.

Rename
Will display an editable box permitting the renaming of the file item both on disk and in the project.

Properties
Will display the ../../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/file_items.xmlFile Item Properties.
